medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced pain and swelling in the right leg and groin approximately 5 weeks before presentation. Four weeks prior to presentation, an emergency department visit revealed a mass in the right groin with surrounding erythema. Subsequent imaging confirmed an irregular mass in the right groin, and pathological examination later identified metastatic melanoma.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, gastroesophageal reflux disease, diverticulitis, cardiomyopathy, coronary artery disease (stent placed 1 year earlier), hearing loss, and extensive sun exposure.
medical_history.family_history: Sister had uterine cancer; maternal grandmother had breast cancer. No family history of melanoma.
medical_history.social_history: Retired landscaper and mechanic, lives with wife. Smoked three packs of cigarettes daily for 20 years (quit 20 years ago), drinks alcohol infrequently, does not use illicit drugs. Remains physically active performing farm work.
